actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: To amend section 225 of the Federal Salary Act of 1967 to clarify the procedures under that section for disapproving pay adjustments recommended by the President, and to provide for reconsideration relating to certain executive, legislative, and judicial salaries (excluding Members of Congress).

summary.text: Amends the Federal Salary Act of 1967 to revise procedures for disapproving pay adjustments recommended by the President for executive, legislative, and judicial salaries. Requires the President to submit recommendations to the Congress with respect to the exact rates of pay considered advisable for Federal officials and judges.

titles.title: To amend section 225 of the Federal Salary Act of 1967 to clarify the procedures under that section for disapproving pay adjustments recommended by the President, and to provide for reconsideration relating to certain executive, legislative, and judicial salaries (excluding Members of Congress).
